html.div: The Splunk platform can index any kind of data. In particular, the Splunk platform can index any and all IT streaming, machine, and historical data, such as Microsoft Windows event logs, web server logs, live application logs, network feeds, metrics, change monitoring, message queues, archive files, and so on. On many operating systems, a Splunk Universal Forwarder can be installed to collect the data and send it to the Splunk platform either directly to the indexers or to Splunk Data Stream Processor acting as a centralized data aggregator.

div.span: Splunk Universal Forwarder, Splunk Data Stream Processor, Splunk Enterprise, Splunk Infrastructure Monitoring, Splunk Application Performance Monitoring

div.p: For Windows and Linux OSes, the easiest way to collect data is to install the Splunk Universal Forwarder which will then send data to your Splunk platform. For devices such as network devices, you can configure TCP or UDP outputs to the Splunk platform or use your existing syslog infrastructure to forward the data to Splunk.
